snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has a proposal to spend as much as $400 million to buy homes wrecked by Hurricane Sandy, demolish them and preserve the undeveloped land.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo is proposing to spend as much as $400 million to purchase homes wrecked by Hurricane Sandy, have them demolished and then preserve the flood-prone land permanently, as undeveloped coastline; plan, if approved, would be one of most ambitious ever undertaken.

byline.contributor: Kirk Semple and Vivian Yee contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has a proposal to spend as much as $400 million to buy homes wrecked by Hurricane Sandy, demolish them and preserve the undeveloped land.

headline.seo: Cuomo Seeking Home Buyouts in Flood Zones
headline.main: Cuomo Seeking Home Buyouts in Flood Zones
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Is Seeking To Curb Building In Flooded Area
